alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 06 at 4:40AM MDT until August 06 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING THROUGH 8 PM MDT FOR NORTHWEST AND NORTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO HOT, DRY, WINDY, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... ...RED FLAG IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH 8 PM MDT MONDAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO HOT, DRY, WINDY, AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS... .A very unusual period of critical fire weather is expected to develop today and continue through at least Monday early evening as exceptionally dry westerly flow impacts northern NM. Hot, dry, windy, and unstable conditions will occur for several hours Monday afternoon across the northern high terrain, surrounding highlands and upper Rio Grande Valley. Similar conditions may exist on Tuesday. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM mdt THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 8 PM MDT this evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (Zone 101). * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 14 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fire that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
